ApiKey.description: Key that allows MongoDB Cloud to access your Datadog account.

Region.description: Two-letter code that indicates which regional URL MongoDB uses to access the Datadog API.

ApiToken.description: Key that allows MongoDB Cloud to access your Flowdock account.

FlowName.description: Human-readable label that identifies your Flowdock Flow.

OrgName.description: Human-readable label that identifies your Flowdock organization.

Type.description: Human-readable label that identifies the service to which you want to integrate with MongoDB Cloud. The value must match the third-party service integration type.

MicrosoftTeamsWebhookUrl.description: Endpoint web address of the Microsoft Teams webhook to which MongoDB Cloud sends notifications.

AccountId.description: Unique 40-hexadecimal digit string that identifies your New Relic account.

LicenseKey.description: Unique 40-hexadecimal digit string that identifies your New Relic license.

ReadToken.description: Query key used to access your New Relic account.

WriteToken.description: Insert key associated with your New Relic account.

ApiKey.description: Key that allows MongoDB Cloud to access your Opsgenie account.

Region.description: Two-letter code that indicates which regional URL MongoDB uses to access the Opsgenie API.

ServiceKey.description: Service key associated with your PagerDuty account.

Enabled.description: Flag that indicates whether someone has activated the Prometheus integration.

ListenAddress.description: Combination of IPv4 address and Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) port or the IANA port alone to which Prometheus binds to ingest MongoDB metrics.

Scheme.description: Security Scheme to apply to HyperText Transfer Protocol (HTTP) traffic between Prometheus and MongoDB Cloud.

ServiceDiscovery.description: Desired method to discover the Prometheus service.

TlsPemPath.description: Root-relative path to the Transport Layer Security (TLS) Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) key and certificate file on the host.

Username.description: Human-readable label that identifies your Prometheus incoming webhook.

ApiToken.description: Key that allows MongoDB Cloud to access your Slack account.

ChannelName.description: Name of the Slack channel to which MongoDB Cloud sends alert notifications.

TeamName.description: Human-readable label that identifies your Slack team. Set this parameter when you configure a legacy Slack integration.

ApiKey.description: Key that allows MongoDB Cloud to access your Splunk On-Call account.

RoutingKey.description: Routing key associated with your Splunk On-Call account.

Secret.description: Parameter returned if someone configure this webhook with a secret.

Url.description: Endpoint web address to which MongoDB Cloud sends notifications.

Href.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that points another API resource to which this response has some relationship. This URL often begins with `https://mms.mongodb.com`.

Rel.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that defines the semantic relationship between this resource and another API resource. This URL often begins with `https://mms.mongodb.com`.

description: Returns, adds, edits, and removes third-party service integration configurations. MongoDB Cloud sends alerts to each third-party service that you configure.

GroupId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies your project.

IncludeCount.description: Flag that indicates whether the response returns the total number of items (**totalCount**) in the response.

IntegrationType.description: Human-readable label that identifies the service which you want to integrate with MongoDB Cloud.

ItemsPerPage.description: Number of items that the response returns per page.

Links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

PageNum.description: Number of the page that displays the current set of the total objects that the response returns.

Results.description: List of returned documents that MongoDB Cloud provides when completing this request.

TotalCount.description: Number of documents returned in this response.

Type.description: Human-readable label that identifies the service to which you want to integrate with MongoDB Cloud. The value must match the third-party service integration type.
